maml:description.maml:para: Clone a version

Clone a version of the CA set from the CA set specified by `versionId`. Note that the clone may reflect expired certificates from the original. This function can use either `-CASetID` or `-CASetName` for ease of use.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
ID of the CA set. You typically require this or the `CASetName`.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Version identifier on which to perform the desired operation.

List CA set activities

List activities on the CA set, sorted reverse chronologically with recent activities first. Apply `start` and `end` parameters to specify a time range. Specify only `start` or `end` to include all activities after or before a given time.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
ID of the CA set. You typically require this or the `CASetName`.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Filters out any activities before this time, expressed as an ISO 8601 timestamp. To specify a fixed time range, pair this with a `start` parameter.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Filters out any activities after this time, expressed as an ISO 8601 timestamp. To specify a fixed time range, pair this with an `end` parameter.

Get a version
List all versions of a CA set, as identified by its `CASetName` or `CASetID`, or retrieve an individual version by its `VersionID`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
If present, the response includes only the versions currently active on either staging or production networks.
ID of the CA set. You typically require this or the `CASetName`.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
If present, the response includes additional certificate data for each version.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Activate a version
Activate the certificates for the version on the specified network. CA set can be identified by its `CASetName` or `CASetID`.

Create a version

Create a new CA set version in the CA set specified by either `CASetName` or `CASetID`. You can provide the certificates for your new version either as a PSCustomObject, or a single file containing 1 or more base-64-encoded certificates, or point to a directory containing 1 or more certificate files. You can also add `Comments` and allow SHA1 signatures with `-AllowInsecureSha1`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
By default, the version's certificates need a signature algorithm of SHA-256 or better. Enabling this allows certificates with SHA-1 signatures.
Name of the CA set. You typically require this or the `CASetID`.
Folder to read individual certificates from. Files should contain base64-encoded certificates.
Any additional comments you can provide while creating or updating the CA set version.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
By default, the version's certificates need a signature algorithm of SHA-256 or better. Enabling this allows certificates with SHA-1 signatures.

File containing one or more base64-encoded certificates.

Update a version

Update the settings for a specified version of your CA set. CA set can be identified by its `CASetName` or `CASetID`. You must provide the `-VersionID` to update, but if you pipe the results of `Get-METSCASetVersion` this parameter will be read from the pipeline. Certificates can be provided either as a PSCustomObject, or a single file containing 1 or more base-64-encoded certificates, or point to a directory containing 1 or more certificate files. You can also add `Comments` and allow SHA1 signatures with `-AllowInsecureSha1`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
By default, the version's certificates need a signature algorithm of SHA-256 or better. Enabling this allows certificates with SHA-1 signatures.
Name of the CA set. You typically require this or the `CASetID`.
Folder to read individual certificates from. Files should contain base64-encoded certificates.
Any additional comments you can provide while creating or updating the CA set version.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Version identifier on which to perform the desired operation.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
By default, the version's certificates need a signature algorithm of SHA-256 or better. Enabling this allows certificates with SHA-1 signatures.
Name of the CA set. You typically require this or the `CASetID`.
File containing one or more base64-encoded certificates.
